str2: (a) gen: with, in company with, (b) acc: (1) behind, beyond, after, of place, (2) after, of time, with nouns, neut. of adjectives.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
(a) din, hubbub, confused noise, outcry, (b) riot, disturbance. From the base of throeo; a disturbance.
A primary verb; to stop, i.e. Restrain, quit, desist, come to an end.
Paul, Paulus. Of Latin origin; Paulus, the name of a Roman and of an apostle.

str2: To send for, summon. From meta and pempo; to send from elsewhere, i.e. to summon or invite.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A learner, disciple, pupil. From manthano; a learner, i.e. Pupil.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: From para and kaleo; to call near, i.e. Invite, invoke.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Middle - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To greet, salute, pay my respects to, welcome. To enfold in the arms, i.e. to salute, to welcome.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To go out, come out. From ek and erchomai; to issue.

parse: Verb - Present Infinitive Middle or Passive

str2: (Hebrew), Macedonia, a Roman province north of Achaia (Greece). From Makedon; Macedonia, a region of Greece.
